intro: Boscia corymbosa, commonly known as the sour fig or wild date tree, is a shrub or small tree native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its rough, fissured bark and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that are typically green when unripe and turn red or yellow when mature. Boscia corymbosa is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in harsh climates. It plays an important role in local ecosystems and has been used traditionally for its edible fruits and medicinal properties.
